result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric V. Steinberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric V. Steinberg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric V. Steinberg was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:03 p.m. Defendant Eric V. Steinberg in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm370, 15ct31, 15tr530, 15tr531, 15tr2093, 15tr2094. Bennett files Plea Questionaire and states agreement. State moves to dismiss 15tr2093, 15tr2094, 15tr530, 15tr531, Count 1 in 15cm370 and to dismiss but read in Count 2 in 15ct31 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2 in 15cm370 and Count 1 in 15ct31.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Bennett/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
15ct31
WHS/POP 3 years
Jail  60 days -With Huber for all purposes -  may be served in Vilas or Bayfield County - to commence on/before February 1, 2016.
Fine $2009 (includes costs)
Blood draw surcharge $35 
Driver's license revocation - 26 months
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA Assessment
Jail credit - 3 days if revoked

15cm370
WHS/POP 3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 30 days concurrent with 15ct31
Restitution - $300 to be paid within first six months of probation

Bond to be applied  - $300 towards restitution and then $300 towards attorneys' fees; balance to be refunded to person who posted bond
$50 payment to be made in January 2016 - no payments due while in jail - payments to resume after release from jail
Appeal rights given
Adj. 3:18 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
Court appointing Brian Bennett as attorney

3:05 P.M. Defendant Eric V. Steinberg in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm370, 15 ct31, 15tr2093, 15tr2094, 15tr 530 and 15tr531. Bennett believes that global resolution is possible.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm. Adj. 3:07 p.m.

1:40 p.m. Defendant Eric V. Steinberg in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm370, 15tr2093, 15tr2094.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Michlig/Bennett statement to bond. Court sets $3000 sig bond.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
